text:
“Listen, Razumihin,” Raskolnikov said. “I’ve just been at a death-bed.” 

Razumihin frowned. “What’s the matter with you?”

“I gave them all my money. I feel weak. Support me.”

“Are you giddy?”

“Yes, but I’m sad. Like a woman.” 

He paused, staring ahead. “Look, a light in my room!”

“Queer! Nastasya?” Razumihin suggested.

“She’s never there at this hour. I don’t care! Good-bye!” 

“What do you mean? I’m coming with you!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses his sadness and confusion to Razumihin after a troubling experience at a death-bed, indicating his emotional turmoil.
